oai_dc:dc.dc:title: NUMERICAL MODELING OF LONG WAVE SHIP MOTIONS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Headland, John R.
Poon, Ying-Keung
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: ship motion
numerical modeling
long waves
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper presents a state-of-the-art numerical model for ship motion analyses along with an application of the model to a seiche problem in the Port of Long Beach, California. The practical uses of the model are emphasized along with a discussion of the efficacy of the modeling approach as a tool for decision-making.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 26 (1998): Proceedings of 26th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Copenhagen, Denmark, 1998.
